University of Pisa (Italy): 12-months research position
University of Pisa (Italy): 12-months research position
Posted on
2 May 2024
The department of Computer Science of the University of Pisa (
https://di.unipi.it/
https://di.unipi.it/
) has opened a call for a position on “Parallel and I/O-efficient compression and indexing techniques for the Software Heritage Archive”.
The ACubeLab (
http://acube.di.unipi.it/
http://acube.di.unipi.it/
) invites expressions of interest for a position with a duration of 12 months (call by 2024).
Admission requirement:
hold a PhD or a Master’s degree in Computer Science
or equivalent (to be obtained by the interview’s date). The ideal candidate should be familiar with the following topics: Algorithms, Data Structures, Programming, Data Compression.
Scientific Topics: The AcubeLab is working on the design and implementation of a compressed storage and indexing solution for the Software Heritage Archive (
https://www.softwareheritage.org/
https://www.softwareheritage.org/
), which is an ambitious initiative launched in 2015 by INRIA (Paris), in agreement with UNESCO, and assembling a group of prestigious supporters and committed sponsors including, among the others, Microsoft, Intel, Google, VMWare, GitHub, Societe Generale, the Alfred P. Sloan Foundation. Its main objective is to collect, preserve, and share software in source code form. At the time of writing, SWH is the largest archive of source code in the world with more than 17 billion source files, coming from more than 250 million projects. This project is also part of our effort in the ICSC (Centro Nazionale di Ricerca in High-Performance Computing, Big Data and Quantum Computing) funded by PNRR. The postdoc, involved in the project, will thus have the opportunity to collaborate with an international environment.
For details and application procedure, please visit the web site:
https://bandi.unipi.it/public/Bandi/Detail/a1c63365-bf11-4ac7-ab06-55cc6cb7b038
For more information, contact: Paolo Ferragina (
paolo.ferragina@unipi.it
)

News Laurea Magistrale in Computer Science

Intermediate verification tests: cancellation
Intermediate verification tests: cancellation
Posted on
18 March 2020
Dear students,
due to the COVID-19 emergency and the prohibitions imposed by the DPGM 9/3/2020 the intermediate verification tests,
scheduled between 30 March and 4 April 2020, are canceled
.
The teaching in that week will not be suspended, but will continue electronically unless otherwise indicated by the teachers of the individual courses.

Cookie Policy
Cookie Policy
This Cookie Policy relates to the website
www.di.unipi.it
A cookie is a small text file containing a unique identification number that is transferred from the website to the hard-disk of your computer through an anonymous code that can identify the computer but not the user and passively monitors your activities on the site in order to enable or improve the service offered.
The site
www.di.unipi.it
uses technical cookies to work correctly and to improve users navigation experience. This type of cookies does not need the consent of users.
We also use third party cookies for embedding video from YouTube (YouTube/Google cookies). This type of cookies requires the consent of users. Consent is meant granted if the user continues its site navigation.
For any further information about Google policy go to:
http://www.google.com/policies/technologies/cookies
For any further information about cookies visit:
http://aboutcookies.org
http://www.youronlinechoices.com
Simplified Arrangements to Provide Information and Obtain Consent Regarding Cookies – 8 may 2014 from the Italian data protection Authority
You can disable cookies directly from your browser
How to disable cookies in
Firefox
How to disable cookies in
Chrome
How to disable cookies in
Internet Explorer
How to disable cookies in
Safari
How to disable cookies in
Opera
How to disable cookies on mobile devices:
Android
Safari
; –
Windows Phone
; –
Blackberry
.
Please note that certain features of the website may be reduced or not available disabling cookies.
